review_body: I have 3 cats, all different sizes, one overweight, one underweight and one just fine. (My 3 little bears...) but this food works for all 3. The bigger one is getting thinner, the thin one is putting on weight and the other is staying as he should. My small girl has a sensitive stomach and had a hard time keeping down the other foods I tried, but does great with this one. Decent ingredients and price. Will continue to buy.

I regularly use IAMS Adult 1-6 yr. (orange bag) I thought I would take a chance and try IAMS Multi Cat, since I do have Multi cats. I works out to cost less per pound and it comes in a larger 22 LB bag. The IAMS orange bag I have been using for years, however 17LBS is as big a bag as I can find, and I run out just days before the end of the month. 22LBS works out perfect. Comparing ingredients its got everything like the orange bag. I would never buy a new brand just cause its alittle cheaper or bigger.  I totally trust IAMS, So I don't have to worry! Hopefully 22LB bags will become available in IAMS other varietys. Oh I almost forgot, THEY LIKE IT !

And has been often constipated. I have tried every dry food out there (picky boy will not eat wet food unless it is Gerber Chicken Baby Food, which settles his stomach but as a steady diet is not feasible).  Even gluten free, grain free, and a wide variety of proteins have produced nasty residuals that stain my carpets, floors, furniture, down comforters, etc. And he has tried exceptionally pricey ones from three different vets, all of which he liked but they didn't like him. It has been three weeks now with this product and the barfing has stopped completely.  The pellets are very small, a size he usually inhales without chewing (which adds to his predisposition to barf). However, he crunches away on this. The breeder told me to never buy any cat food available in a grocery store because the ingredients are not regulated; she used to work at a Purina cattery and has horrible horror stories about what gets thrown into the mix. So for 13 years it has been
Petsmart, Amazon, or the vets. I bought this product the first time in a pinch in the
grocery store. Surprise! He likes it and it likes him. And he is pooping Baby Ruths!
And even with the $4.99 shipping from a third party supplier to Amazon, it is still $13.28 less expensive through Amazon than at the grocery store; and of course having it delivered to my front door instead of lugging it 2 blocks from my parking garage is a bonus.
summary: My Burmese show cat has been barfing for 13 years

Out of four indoor cats who grace my home, two of them have a problem with vomiting a little too frequently.  They're healthy, but often eat too much at one time and it all comes back up.  I chose IAMS Proactive Health Specialized dry cat food for Healthy Digestion.  This dry cat food has really cut back on the vomiting problem.  The cats like it and they chew the pieces up rather than swallowing it whole as they do with some other foods.

Ill buy Purina 1 next time...
summary: Might be good hairball food but they should make the morsels smaller

review_body:
I gave it 2 stars because the cats didn't hate it.
I have been wanting to switch our cats from eating Natural Balance LID, ever since the company was sold, and I noticed a big difference in quality of ingredients. It used to be just the best dry cat food, at a good price, and then gradually our cats started having more issues, like hairballs and vomiting, loose stools off and on, then last year 2 of our cats had seizures, and passed away 6 months from each other. We don't know why, but it definitely could have been the food.
Pet food companies are trying to keep their profits high, while offering grain-free formulas, at low cost. That has meant trying to get cheaper meat, and people having lost pets, to food contaminated with euthanasia drugs. I would rather my cats eat grain, than be poisoned by cheap meat, that is basically animals that were put down, then made into pet food. The FDA has lifted the penalties for companies that get caught breaking the laws that say you can't put meat in pet food from an animal that was put down, instead of slaughtered.
 I thought trying a big name middle ground pet food would be safer. I did what you have to do when switching foods, by just adding a little of the new food at a time, over about a month. I expected a bit of vomiting the first week, but they continue to have diarrhea, and it has meant them going outside the litter box several times. They do that to tell you that they feel sick. Haven't been able to switch more than half this food, and half their NB LID, after a month. I think I'm just going to have to bite the bullet and buy expensive dry food.
 If you have been feeding your cat dirt cheap grocery store cat food, this might be ok for your cat. But this isn't better than Natural Balance LID. Your cat won't have digestive issues when you switch them to a higher quality food than they have been eating, unless they are allergic to something in it, when done right. We already have one cat on prescription diet wet food, because the Natural Balance gave him urinary crystals and blockage. That shouldn't happen on high quality food. He won't eat the super healthy dry food you can get here off Amazon. It's not easy to find something that's good for them, they will eat, that doesn't cost a fortune, or come down to making them food by hand.
The search continues.
Decrease in vomiting. Cats like it. Has brewers yeast, which repels fleas and provides B vitamins.
summary: So far so good. Contains Brewers yeast.

Which that is just Incredible. No stomach issues with this either. Doesnt smell bad. Vet said good brand, but I should add wet food to their diet as well so they can better stay hydrated and keeps kidneys healthy. This will also help them to intake less carbohydrates since dry food has more of it. Either one meal dry and one meal wet or just mix some wet food with the dry. Havent done that yet though.
summary: Doesnt smell bad. Vet said good brand

I don't use this as my main cat foodI get that at Costco. But I buy these convenient 7lb bags of IAMS food to give my cats a change of pace with their dry food. (I also give them wet food 1-2 times a week.) I have 5 Siamese cats, ages 814, and they all LOVE this food. Not only do they love it, but it doesnt make any of them throw up. *hear the angels singing* The 7lb bag is small enough to fit in my hall cupboard on a shelf. Or I dump the entire thing into my Petnet SmartFeeder. The ingredients are good. Its actually, price per pound (at all the times Ive seen it), the cheapest non-junk cat food you can buy on Amazon (and actually its cheaper than what I get from Costco too). I couldn't believe that the cheapest stuff I found would be the best; I tried about 4 different brands, and none were any better than this one. When you have 5 cats, the cost is a major draw. When you have old cats, the health factor is huge. This food does the trick!

review_body: I have a cat with digestive issues this cat food helped alot.

I have tried everything I could think of that will lessen my cat puking after each meal....I tried blue, CRAVE, Special Diet, Rachel Ray, etc.....nothing worked. When my cat was younger, she could eat Purina indoor or meow mix cat food and be find; in her old age now nope she throws up after every meal and the vet doesn't know why (could be an allergy or a sensitive stomach) and this led me to trying every food I could think of to lessen this bulimic behavior in her. Finally, my mom comes home from a clearance bag of IAMS sensitive cat food, and I was thinking to myself "here is another waste of time" and long behold after a week on this food she does not puke up her food as much after eating (she still does occasionally, but that's because she has PICA). Now my issue is that all the stores near me no longer carry this formula in IAMS, and if they do it is the holy grail. So, thank goodness Amazon has it because I just bought a grain free IAMS food that my store did have and she has been throwing up after every bite for the last 2 hours....so here I am ordering it one day delivery from Amazon. This is a life saver....so if you have a bulimic older cat and have tried ever cat food out there (even the 40 dollar bag cat foods and wet foods) and have had no luck; then I recommend you give this cat food a try you may be thanking your lucky stars that you are no longer hearing that awful sound as often as you do now.

This review is 100% honest and in no way made up...and I had to pay full price for the product (how do I get discounts because I am willing to leave reviews for discounts).

review_body: And who does not like less cat vomit?  I have two cats (each over 10 years of age) who overeat and then vomit.  We were feeding them Purina Cat Chow.  It had become something we simply got accustomed to (no health issues per vet) but then it got out of control.  We were cleaning up multiple large piles each day and it was ruining throw rugs, bedspreads, sofas and carpets.  We could not leave shoes or papers or really anything laying around for fear it would be damaged.  They even got my new suede slippers!  Enough already!  So I gave Iams Proactive Health Sensitive Stomach a try.  I really was very skeptical, but it has vastly improved the cat vomit issue at our house.  It has gone down from multiple times per day to maybe once every 7 - 10 days, and when it does happen, it seems like it is smaller, dryer, less damaging.  I also put less food in the bowl, hoping that would make a difference - hoping if they ate and got to the bottom of the bowl, they would stop.  I'm not sure if that helped or not but as long as this good progress keeps up, I will keep doing that.  All cats are different, so this may or may not work for you but I did have success with it.  If your cat vomits, do have it checked by a vet!
My boys eat every kibble :)

review_body: I like this for my animals because there are no fake colors or shapes to please people.  I gave it three stars because I would rather more meat and less grains.  However, since I have so many animals, I have to compromise.

As my cat has gotten older, she has been putting me through the test with food. She would stop eating midway through a bag, even the smallest I could buy. She would appear to be "tired" of the taste, and the fool human that I am, I kept changing her out (gradually adjusting to something new). People said, "Leave it there and she'll eat it", but she wouldn't! I noticed a bit of a weight loss and got concerned enough for a vet visit who said she was getting older, not as active, doesn't need so much, but suggested Iams. I just ordered more of this because she finished off the bag. Enough said.
Unfortunately, Iams, as with many other brands I've tried, has not had a positive effect.  My kitty continues to erp nearly every time she eats '~'
hAVE 5 CATS THAT AARE DOING FINE.  IT RERALLY HELPS.
great as always. I mix it with my pets gastrointestinal hard prescription food to make it last longer
This a large size bag but we do have 3 cars to feed, all of which seem to like this cat food.

Mixing the "regular" formula with the weight control formula seems to work well for my cats. They like it, have eaten it for 18+ years, have maintained a moderate weight throughout their lives, and are quite healthy. I'm sure other products may be more "natural" or even theoretically healthier, but they are also quite expensive when feeding multiple cats. And hey, I'm sure with more money and a willingness to sacrifice taste, my diet could also be healthier, too! I may be a sucker for falling for corporate marketing, but to me Iams is a good balance between quality, price, and desirability to my cats. They like it and I feel good about feeding it to them. In addition, I really like the amazon "subscribe & save" option because by having food delivered every month it ensures I don't run out, I don't have to lug bags home from the store, and I save money.
summary: My cats approve and I can afford it!

review_body: My cat has a very sensitive stomach & I was getting sick of cleaning up puke (plus it can't be that much fun for the poor cat either). So far so good. (Though she seems to like the "taste" of the stuff that makes her vomit better than she likes this). Oh well, what's a person to do?
cats don't throw up eating this
My cats love this and it makes their coats fluffy.
My female cat used vomit after eating until I started using Iams.  Since I changed their diet there has been much less of that. Thank you!
summary: My female cat used vomit after eating until I started ...

review_body: My cats are old & can keep this food down without having to put them on soft food
17yaer old cat has been eating this for past 13 years due to vomiting issues which have greatly decreased with this food.  Recommend buy
I am very happy with this product as it doesn't cause flares of my cat's skin allergies, and it is cheaper than the product in which I had been previously purchasing! Cheaper price...YAY!!
Decent quality food and my cat loves it.

This very good cat food. I have six cats and they all enjoy it. In fact, one of them will only eat Iams dry cat food. Okay "yes" he is a little spoiled but, I would rather have healthy fur babies and if that means spending the money for Iams than so be it.

Have used now for two weeks. Two cats, one has been a chronic regurgitator..I've tried everything for the past two years. Problem was lessened with high dollar foods and slow feeders, but still upchucking once every other day. Switched to this, and no more problems! Still using slow feeder. Second cat just went nuts over this food! Both love it!! I am SOOOOO relieved to no longer have to clean my carpets constantly!
Cats love this food.
My cat loves this food!  Thank you Amazon for providing an excellent way to obtain this product with easy along with a good price!
summary: Thank you Amazon for providing an excellent way to obtain this product with easy along with ...

review_body: This food has really worked out for us. Before, my cats (I have 4) were constantly puking the other food. As soon as I started them on this food, the puking is generally non esistent. I might find a little gift of puke very rarely, that's it.
My cats like it, and it helps with keeping their weight down slightly so I'm happy also.
Really helped my cats. No more throwing up food
WOW. My cats ate the food when they got hungry. Incredible
Love the brand. I also get the Iams version for my dog.
My cat likes it, and he eats the same amount and has lost a few pounds.  Hes a little thinner and that's what the vet recommended.  Good stuff!!

Since changing from regular (orange bag) Iams to this 'sensitive stomach' formula -- my cat has only vomited once -- and that was so soon after the switch, so I blame former Iams diet still in kitty's system for that one.  Otherwise, no vomiting since the switch!!!
Also, my cat never noticed the 'switch' so the taste must be similar.
I will continue to feed this.

Update: Turns out my cat's vomiting was from eating too fast.  I still feed my cat this Iam's Healthy Digestion formula though, since she likes it.
I like it better than the kitties do. They don't throw up all over the place. They eat it because it's there. They'd rather eat sickening grainy foods.

review_body: My cats will eat it.  That's the main thing.  For all four of them being previously homeless they sure are picky.  The one I adopted when he was nine having been rescued out of a hoarders house  with 29 other cats seems to be the pickiest.
I have used Iams products for years with good results. My cats and dogs do quite well on it. The hairball formula seems to really help my cat. I would highly recommend.

I have been feeding my cat this food and it's great.  However My package arrived today, and the box was fine, and the other two items were fine, but the cat food had a hole in the bag and was half full. review_body: My three kitties love this

This stuff really works.  I have an eight year old male cat who has been eating this for most of his adult life.  Not only does he prefer it over other foods (I've offered several, side by side...) but he's never been overweight.  I don't know if that's because of the food or not, but... see below.

The other great thing is that this stuff really does decrease hairballs.  I know, because whenever I run out and have to use a different kind of food for a week or two, my cat's hairball production goes up considerably.

Highly recommended.

review_body: This is the only food I have found that keeps my cats from lacking up ducky hairballs all over the rug. Tried IAMS gentle in blue bag and it does not work near as good as the orange bag.
my cats like it and was a great price
both of my cats love this food.  I have one cat that has an extremely sensitive stomach.  She is so much better since we switched to this food.

review_body: Have 4 cats, 1 of them with super sensitive stomach. Mainly bought this for her. She does much better on this than any other I've tried. My other cats prefer the taste of this over theirs, so now all 4 eat this and love it.
My cats seem to really like this.
My six-year old most indoor cat likes this and has been eating it for the last four years or ever since I got her.  I'm hoping that it will keep her healthy and active.

review_body: Worked so well, no more cat vomit to clean up.....
made my cat sick so have stopped using iams. very disappointed!
Well, my cat likes it.  He has not complained to me!
Great for an older cat. Really helped cut down on the vomiting of undigested food.

My cats love it and that's all that counts.  One was having a problem with tummy issues and this sure solved it.  I ordered two bags.  They were well packaged and came in record time.  Price was much better than what I was paying at Publix.

I have one cat the seem the throw up a little more than normal and I bought her this food and she has been throwing up near as much.  She still get fur balls and that can't be helped especially since she like to groom our other two cats.
summary: She still get fur balls and that can't be helped especially since she like to groom our other two cats

review_body: Only brand of kitty food I buy

I have 2 long haired cats. One is a senior and one is about a year old. This food really makes a difference with the senior in particular because she has always had a terrible issue with hairballs. As she gets older, it seems like she throws up food randomly more often, too. She does well with this food though and I can tell a difference even when I switch between different Iams varieties. I like to stick with this one, the Original in the orange bag, and the pink bag for mature cats once in a while. The hairball variety and the Original orange bag seem to be the best for her. The younger cat eats pretty much anything with no issues and despite her constantly grooming her long hair she hasn't had any hairball issues yet at all that Ive noticed. They like this food and do well on it, so I see no reason to switch.
Great dry food for cats.  Mine love it.
my cat would not eat anything just nibbled but he likes this big time. He also has not thrown up like with the other foods! I hope it lasts!
best food out there for cats with hairball problems.  I have tried others, and they don't seem to work as well.
summary: best food out there for cats with hairball problems

review_body: My kitties like this.
Boots eats it but he still has hairball incidents
Cats won't touch this food got it for good reviews have 4 cats not 1 will eat it.
my cats love this food
This food has been helpful in returning my chunky cat to a proper, healthy weight.  And, he likes it!

Great cat food.  My cats love this food. It is Iams and cats love the taste.  Also when I first adopted my Leopold from a shelter he kept farting all the time.  It is not a healthy animal that does that; it is caused by upset stomach from the food he was fed.  I started him on Iams right away and in 1 week no more farts at all.  He is extremely healthy and I did try other very well known high quality cat food but Iams is it for me.  Plus I NEVER FEED MY CATS PEOPLE FOOD.  No snacks either.  Their weight is perfect and I do leave food in their bowls all day.
The cats seems to like this dry food. Hopefully its helping with hairballs like it advertises. Only the cats know if they feel any better.

The cat food itself: I have been supplementing my cat's diet with IAMS Proactive Health Indoor cat food for almost 15 years. My cat is a fussy eater but will eat this cat food. (Though she prefers her canned cat food.) I like that helps with her weight and more importantly to me with reducing hairballs.

Mars Private US: Provided the correct type of IAMS cat food in a very prompt manner and it arrived in perfect condition.
I have been feeding my 2 older cats, 3 & 6 yoa, this brand from the get-go and they Love it!  Now if I could get the kittens to stay out of it, LOL!
Our cats love this Purina food.  Size makes it a must to buy online.  Price is reasonable and home delivery is a definite plus.  We have 3 Siamese little girls and they love this food.

I have purchased lots of food for my cat. She has soooo many allergies and she gets sick from certain foods. This has helped her maintain digestion. She was getting sick 4 times a day from different cat foods that claimed to help. She loves the taste and her hair is actually starting to grow back on her back. Will purchase again!
summary: Great for Cats with Allergies & Tummy issues

review_body: More affordable than the pro plan or back to basics. I know it's not the best, but it's better than some of others. My cats turds are huge and they don't seem satiated between feedings. May go back to back to basics or Rachel ray.
I don't know if my kitties like this quite as well as the naturals, however mama does. It seems to give them the oils they need to help control hairballs.
summary: I don't know if my kitties like this quite as well as the naturals

My cat likes it. I feel it is a good food. He grew up on Science Diet kitten. Hated the Science Diet adult. He loves this. As with other premium pet foods, don't have to feed as much as a complete cat food. And, he likes this one.
summary: Good premium cat food. Worth the money.

review_body: This bag lasts my cat over 3 months - much more economical than buying the small bags from the grocery store.  I store in an air-tight pet food bin and dole it out daily.  That way my cat can't get into the bag and spread the food all over the floor.  I picked the air-tight container up from a local discount store for $12.99.  Overall - I think this is just a much more economical way for me to keep the food my cat loves in the house.
summary: My cat loves it - one bag lasts me 3 months with one cat

review_body: Great value and my cat thrives on this food!
Good, great to deliver to my door so I don't have a trip to make and a heavy bag to carry.
summary: Good, great to deliver to my door so I ...

review_body: Been buying for years for long haired Maine coon. Shiny fur and no hairballs.
summary: Long haired Mainecoon has shiny coat and no hairballs

review_body: Tried several different kinds of cat food. This is what cats like.

This is all my Maine Coon cat will eat. He hates all other kitty food, even wet food and with his long hair the hairball remedy helps him a lot. The price seems to vary a lot so I order two bags whenever I see it listed for $17-18. One bag lasts us about 4-5 weeks with 2 cats. One large (the Maine Coon) and one smaller cat (siamese mix).
summary: Great for Maine Coon and other Cats with Lots of Fur

review_body: My somewhat fussy cat loves this dry cat food.  He has been "hacking" recently so I thought it might help him.  He doesn't allow any brushing and even though he is a fairly short hair, he still sheds and I'm sure ingests a lot of hair while grooming himself.  Have tried other brands which he won't eat - so this one is a win-win for both of us.  Thanks Iams.
summary: Fussy cat loves Iams Hairball Care Dry Cat Foos

review_body: Buyer beware.... the product is fine but not when it comes full of mold and makes the cat sick.  The vet tested some of the bag and suggested not buying this online again!
Best product I can find for my long haired, indoor cats.  A+

I have been feeding my cats Iams for a few years now, especially since one of them tends to have a sensitive stomach and only seems to keep Iams Original and Iams Sensitive Stomach down 99% of the time.  She throws up mostly every other brand so I don't even bother anymore.  I figured I would expand their choice by trying this one, but sadly, neither cat ate much of it at all.
summary: Iams is a name I trust, and a brand my cats love, but neither liked this variety

review_body: Good price and so grateful it is delivered to the front door!  It has been difficult to find this size locally - usually only 3+or over15 lb bags. I have always fed my jadult cats this particular brand.  Sam transitioned easily to this from Iams kitten food (no digestive tract problems).
My cats' favorite dry food ever!
Works well for my Maine Coon kitten.  Iam's hairball cat food is the only dry food his breeder recommends

Well if kitty is happy, then who am I to say otherwise?
She eats it and we haven't noticed any concerns with hairballs and that's a relief.  I can't say for certain that there is a connection, but she does fine eating it.

My cat is the perfect target market for this food: she's indoor, has weight issues, and is prone to hairballs. I cycle her through a variety of dry foods. I feed her canned, Weruva food in the morning. In the evening, I give her a bit of dry food to hold her until morning. Typically I choose dry foods that are targeted to weight and/or hairball issues. She's not a picky eater and will eat whatever I give her, but has her favorites for sure. Iams proactive health is definitely a new favorite. She loves the taste, her bowel movements have improved, and her hairballs are less frequent.

Other reviewers are complaining about the ingredients, but I'm only seeing positive results with the food. Considering it's not my cat's only source of nutrition, I'm sold.
summary: Cat loves it and it's working well

review_body:
As much as I would have liked to give this food a good review, one look at the ingredient list* and I was not very impressed.  The first ingredient listed is chicken by-product meal, which is NOT near as high-quality an ingredient as if it was listed as "Chicken".  But the next two ingredients are corn products - corn meal, corn grits and the rest of the ingredient list is equally unimpressive.

My cats are not picky so yes, they will eat it.  But this is not the high-quality diet I prefer to feed them, to avoid health issues related to poor diet.

Iams is a well-known brand and not the cheapest pet food out there so I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in this variety.

*(Copied and pasted from Amazon product page) Ingredient list:
CHICKEN BY-PRODUCT MEAL, CORN MEAL, CORN GRITS, GROUND WHOLE GRAIN SORGHUM, DRIED BEET PULP, POWDERED CELLULOSE, CHICKEN, CHICKEN FAT (PRESERVED WITH MIXED TOCOPHEROLS, A SOURCE OF VITAMIN E), DRIED EGG PRODUCT, NATURAL FLAVOR, BREWERS DRIED YEAST, SODIUM BISULFATE, POTASSIUM CHLORIDE, CHOLINE CHLORIDE, DL-METHIONINE, FISH OIL (PRESERVED WITH MIXED TOCOPHEROLS, A SOURCE OF VITAMIN E), FRUCTOOLIGOSACCHARIDES, DICALCIUM PHOSPHATE, CALCIUM CARBONATE, SALT, VITAMINS (VITAMIN E SUPPLEMENT, NIACIN, ASCORBIC ACID, VITAMIN A ACETATE, CALCIUM PANTOTHENATE, BIOTIN, THIAMINE MONONITRATE (SOURCE OF VITAMIN B1), PYRIDOXINE HYDROCHLORIDE (SOURCE OF VITAMIN B6), VITAMIN B12 SUPPLEMENT, RIBOFLAVIN SUPPLEMENT (SOURCE OF VITAMIN B2), INOSITOL, VITAMIN D3 SUPPLEMENT, FOLIC ACID), TAURINE, MINERALS (ZINC OXIDE, MANGANESE SULFATE, COPPER SULFATE, POTASSIUM IODIDE), L-CARNITINE, CITRIC ACID, ROSEMARY EXTRACT

I have two cats. One gets hair balls and the other is quite overweight, at 25 lbs. We have introduced numerous dietary options to their diets at great cost without much success. They only eat certain flavors and would rather be hungry then eat something unappealing.

IAMS indoor weight and hairball prevention dry cat food has proven to be the ideal product. It works and is not nearly as expensive as some other brands, especially for weight loss. Not only do the cats really like the flavor, they are not getting sick or putting on more weight. In fact, the heavier cat lost a half pound in the past week or two. The other cat rarely will eat dry food, and she has been devouring it.

IAMS Proactive Health Indoor Weight and Hairball control formula is a decent cat food for adult cats.  My older cat, who was very picky, was a big fan of IAMS in the dark green bag (Senior Plus or Lively Senior), so when he passed and we got a new rescue cat, I decided to see if he would enjoy the younger cat version of the food.

Being a rescue cat, Simon is used to eating whatever is donated to the group.  He was on Purina One, and after the appropriate switch over time, he is now eating the IAMS alone.  He is eating the same quantity of food as before, and everything digestive tract wise is the same as one the Purina One.

Good value for the price, and my less than choosy cat eats it.
summary: Good value for a mid-range cat food

review_body: My cat has decided that this is all she will eat, I tried mixing it with other food to get rid of the old food.  I ended up having to pick out the food she deemed as inedible (she was fine with it before) so this was the only food in the bowl, she is strongly committed to this food.
summary: I ended up having to pick out the food she deemed as inedible (she was fine with it before) so this was the only food ...

review_body:
Heres the nutrition profile, since Amazon doesnt have it shown:
Crude Protein, minimum  32.00%
Crude Fat, minimum  13.00%
Crude Fat, maximum  15.50%
Crude Fiber, maximum 6.50%
Moisture, maximum  10.00%
Ash, maximum  7.00%
Magnesium, maximum  0.10%
Vitamin E, minimum  250 IU/kg
Taurine, minimum 0.15%
L-Carnitine, minimum 80 mg/kg
Omega-6 Fatty Acids, minimum 1.67%
Omega-3 Fatty Acids, minimum 0.17%

This food has 3,381 kcal/kg, or 288.06 kcal/cup.

Since l-carnitine is promoted as a reason to select this particular food, I will take a closer look at it.  It occurs naturally in meat, and extra is added to this food.

Do note, however, that high levels of l-carnitine probably aren't a good idea if your cat has hypothyroidism, as the study Carnitine is a naturally occurring inhibitor of thyroid hormone nuclear uptake in the Thyroid: Official Journal of the American Thyroid Association indicates that l-carnitine is an antagonist of thyroid hormone.  The abstract of this study states, At 10 mM carnitine, inhibition of T3 nuclear uptake was disproportionately higher, namely approximately 25% in neurons and 35% in hepatocytes. At 50 mM carnitine, there was a minimal additional decrease in whole-cell uptake of either hormone but a marked decrease in T3 nuclear uptake. The latter inhibition was approximately 60% in neurons and 70% in hepatocytes. We are aware of no inhibitor of TH uptake that has such a markedly different effect on the nuclear versus whole-cell uptake. Our data are consistent with carnitine being a peripheral antagonist of TH action, and they indicate a site of inhibition at or before the nuclear envelope.  That is of some concern to me, as overweight cats may, indeed, have hypothyroidism.
On the other hand, l-carnitine is probably beneficial if your cat has HYPERthryoidism and this disorder is far more common.  L-carnitine may help reduce some symptoms of hyperthyroidism.

L-carnitine may help your cat lose weight while maintaining lean muscle mass.  Research on this is still preliminary.  The study Dietary L-carnitine supplementation in obese cats alters carnitine metabolism and decreases ketosis during fasting and induced hepatic lipidosis states These results demonstrate the protective effect of a dietary L-carnitine supplement against fasting ketosis during obesity induction. Increasing the L-carnitine level of diets in cats with low energy requirements, such as after neutering, and a high risk of obesity could therefore be recommended.  Since fasting ketosis is a serious issue with cats who lose weight too rapidly, this is important.

Overall, Im not impressed with the amount of corn in this food.  I prefer the Iams ProActive Health Adult Hairball Care food, which has chicken and then chicken by-product meal as the top two ingredients.  This other formula has the same amount of l-carnitine as the reviewed food.  Indeed, all the Iams dry cat food I checked has the same amount of l-carnitine, though only some of them are actively promoted as having l-carnitine to help burn fat and maintain healthy metabolism.  To conclude, I think there are better Iams foods than this one.
summary: Important info for cats with thyroid problems

review_body: I have reviewed several cat foods in the past couple years: Solid Gold Furrever Young Holistic Dry Cat Food, Turkey, Brown Rice & Cranberry, Less Active Adult Cats, All Sizes, 4lb Bag NUTRO Adult Cat Chunky Loaf Chicken Dinner Canned Cat Food (Pack of 24) Nutro Core Dry Cat Food Company High Protein Adult Food with Chicken and Whole Brown Rice Recipe for Finicky Felines, 3-Pound Hill's Ideal Balance Crafted Grain Free Herbed Chicken and Chickpeas Recipe Dry Cat Food Bag, 6-Pound This IAMS "Indoor Weight and Hairball Care" food is really not that good. It has a lot of fillers in it (corn, sorghum, beet pulp, cellulose(!)) and a bunch of chemicals that I assume are mostly vitamins to make up for the lack of natural nutrition. The cats will eat it, but I think better of my pets than to feed them cheap junk food. Felines don't eat this stuff in nature. The best dry cat food I have tested is the Hill's Ideal Balance. There are also some other brands with less or no fillers, like Instinct, Nutrish and Nutro. Also, one I have not tried yet, but seems to be higher-end is this: Orijen Cat & Kitten Dry Cat Food 5 Lbs. Let me know in the comments if you try this one and like it.
summary: Fillers and chemicals... but "where's the beef?"

review_body:
While I don't think this is the best cat food available, it's what my cats want to eat. And it's certainly better than Meow Mix and those cheaper grocery store foods. I remember when I first started purchasing this maybe 10+ years ago, it wasn't available at the supermarket at all. Occasionally I will try something more expensive, supposedly better, or even grain-free, and my cats will be gung-ho on eating the new cat food for a few weeks - then they lose interest in it. They want their Iams back. My oldest cat ate this most of her life and she almost made it to age 18. Even when her kidneys were failing she didn't want the prescription kidney diet, she wanted this....and at that stage my vet said it's better she eats the Iams than not eat at all.

As far as hairballs, this helps some. I also give Laxatone and I try to brush my Maine Coon daily, but she still has an occasional hairball but it's on the smaller side. This food works better at controlling hairballs than OTHER brands of hairball food I've tried that were twice the price.

This is also lower in calories if you check the nutritional kcals of other foods online, this one is about 2/3 of the caloric value compared to more expensive hairball/weight management brands other than Iams.

My cats give this 5 stars, I give it 4.
Kitties seem to like it, although they appear to be eating slightly more of it than their previous food. No extra hairballs.
My cats, tore into this before they even finished the food they had. That is how much they love it. I actually mixed the old food with this? and they PICKED out this food and left the other!

we have 6 cats.  4 out of the 6 ate this.  the other 2 are kinda picky, but after a couple of days they will nibble at dry food.  these 2 cats after 4 days still did eat it.  so for the 4 that did.  they ate it real good.  usually have to fill their bowl every 3-4 days.  it took 3 days for the 4 to empty the bowl.  so 4 out of 6 cats says the taste is good.  now for squeaker, she is the one that always gets hairballs.  after 4 days i noticed that she was hacking less, and was not licking herself as much.  no other food or medicine has done this for her.  we will see after a couple of weeks if she quits hacking and licking herself.
summary: iams proactive indoor weight and hairball dry cat food

review_body:
When I see the name IAMS, along with the higher price, I have higher expectations. The main ingredients here are "chicken by-products" followed by corn meal and corn grits. If you look about About dot Com (the cat nutrition section), specifically the essay titled "What's wrong with by-products in cat food?", you'll see that this combo of mysterious by-products and grain fillers may not really be a "proactive health" choice. If you look at 9 Lives Indoor Complete (hairball control), which is almost half the price of this Iams formula, the top three ingredients are the same: Whole ground corn, poultry by-product meal, corn gluten meal . . . Yes, the order is different, is different which means Iam's has a higher ratio of by-product, but there's no way to tell how much. The whole issue of GMO corn is another concern.

The bottom line is that I'm just not confident this is a good choice or worth the extra price compared to something like 9 Lives. We had a cat develop diabetes a few years back, and so I'm wary about corn fillers overall. Also, although both our cats seem to like the taste of this Iams (note that they word it as chicken FLAVORED), we have not noticed any reduction in hairballs.

The ultimate choice is yours, but we will be moving on.

Iams is a decent quality food, a step up from the regular grocery store brands, but not as high tiered as the super premium brands. It is a good enough quality food that my cats with sensitive digestive tracts can eat it without vomiting. There are different dietary needs of the cats in my house, but this food is perfect for my maturing feline that isn't as active as she used to be. This food has helped me to help her to maintain a healthy weight about her. The food itself looks consistent and doesn't have any odd or fishy smells to it.

My two cats are strictly indoor cats and, while we try to keep them active with cat toys, kitty towers, laser pointers, etc. they are slowing down a bit as they age, sleeping longer and playing less. Because of this, the vet warned us to watch their weight - one cat in particular - so I was happy to have an opportunity to review IAMS Proactive Health Specialized Dry Cat Food.

My cats love IAMS Proactive Health Specialized Dry Cat Food! I could tell the cat food was going to be a hit as soon as I opened the box and took out the bag  both my cats went after the bag of cat food and started biting it and tearing it with their claws until they tore a hole in the bag  once they did that, they immediately began eating the cat food that had spilled out! I have since hidden away the bag of cat food but they devour the cart food when I fill their cat food bowls. They have had no problems keeping the food down - no nasty throw up or hairballs - and often empty their food dish before it is time to feed them again. I have been weighting my cat with the problem weight on a daily basis and I am happy to say she has not gained any weight since starting to eat this cat food.

My cats love IAMS Proactive Health Specialized Dry Cat Food!
summary: My cats give this two paws up!

review_body:
We have two middle aged indoor cats, and this is the only food we will feed them.  (1) Although they have sensitive enough stomachs that they throw up almost anything else, they can almost always keep this down; (2) I can't guarantee that it's thanks to IAMS, but they definitely have stayed at healthy weights and haven't had hairball problems while eating this food and (3) they love it - they just can't wait to be fed.

Recommended - , as I said, it keeps out indoor cats healthy and happy!
summary: Keeps our indoor kitties healthy and happy!

review_body: We have a very finicky cat who throws up his food if it is not up to his standards. IAMS Proactive Health is up to his standards. He likes it and never has any problems keeping it down.
summary: the stuff our finicky cat loves

review_body:
This is about the fifth hairball-prevention cat food I have tried. None of the others were successful at all. My cat simply wouldn't eat them. I am frantic because I have a long-haired cat who throws up fur balls every couple of days, which is very distressing. It seems the more expensive, fancy, and health-oriented the food was, the less likely she would eat it. I guess my cat is just a junk food junky, preferring cheap supermarket brands over specialty brands.

The box containing this Iams Proactive Health cat food arrived yesterday from Amazon. I left the package in my study along with my other mail, intending to open it later. This morning, when I entered my study, I found that my cat had not only clawed the Amazon box open, but had torn into the bag of cat food and begun eating it. Now, I always knew my cat was clever and perceptive, but I didn't think she could smell food through two layers of packaging, let alone claw her way through it to get to the food. And believe me, she is well-fed, so she wasn't starving.

In short, she LOVES this food! We have obviously not used it long enough to evaluate the hairball prevention, but it's passed a hurdle none of the others has-- getting her to actually EAT the stuff. And, the price is right.
summary: My cat clawed her way into the package herself and started eating

review_body:
Our cats are picky eaters.  They tend to barf a lot when we change food, even after giving them months to adjust.

This formula is their favorite:
- They seem to vomit less.
- They appear happy and healthy.
- They dislike when we've tried other brands.

While I have not tried this food personally, the two fur balls love the blue Iams bag so we are giving this 5 stars.

Nutrition and price are decent, especially if you buy the larger bags.
summary: Our two black cats love the blue bag

review_body:
This product seems to work well and my cat is happy to eat it but I also think it's a little pricey for the ingredients.  I noticed that if you buy the larger bags though it's a much better deal.  I jump at the chance to try these foods because my 16 year old has suffered from hairballs his whole life.  These foods that have come out the past few years really make a difference.  Maybe the ingredients are required for their hairball formula but I still think just a little pricey.  Otherwise, it's a good product.  And if you're like me and are completely tired of cleaning up hairballs it's worth it.  I also like that it just keeps the cat from having to go through it.

UPDATE:  I am updating this because my cat didn't throw up once the entire time I had this bag of food.  He usually throws up hairballs very frequently.  Well after running out of this, about 1.5 weeks later my 16 year old baby threw up everywhere along with his hairball.  I felt so guilty for not having  already bought him more of this.  It seemed to take so much out of him and he was just drained after.  Will be purchasing more and updating to 5 stars.  It works!
summary: Relief for The Cat - It works!!!

review_body:
For a weight control product, I am surprised corn is one of the main ingredients. First of all, corn is the reason most beef has such high fat content ribboned throughout the meat, as opposed to drastically leaner and less cholesterol-containing grass-fed beef. Corn allows mammals to build fat more rapidly and keep it. Not only this, but cats are carnivores, not omnivores, and technically, they should have diets made exclusively of animal product. This is very high in fillers, and corn is pretty much the worst one. Brown rice would have been better, if it was going to have a filler.

The cats like it, and I'll feed it to them, but it is definitely not good for them.

IAMs is an average brand filled with not so great ingredients. The cat seems to like the flavor well enough and I like to use it as a fast alternative to switch up the diet now and then because she gets very finicky and stops eating once having grown tired of the flavor. However, due to the ingredients, this is not a food I'd buy on a regular basis.

I was curious why this Iams formula and size was considerably more affordable than the rest of the Iams cat recipes.  I buy Iams for a cat rescue friend since all her cats have been raised on it.  I was quite surprised to see that the top three ingredients were chicken by-product meal, corn meal and corn grits in this teal bag.  That's not all that nutritious. Compare that to the ingredients in the  Iams Original in the orange bag of chicken, chicken by-product meal and corn meal, which is just a tad better.

And that claim that this kibble is a "new larger size" also seems to be silly because when placed side-by-side, I see no difference in the kibbles' size.

This formula contains 28%  min crude protein and 11% - 13.5% crude fat, so less protein and fat than the Original formula of 32% and 15% min respectively.  Older indoor cats don't need as much protein and fat as younger, more active cats.

This formula advertises to contain 80mg of L-carnitine, but the Original formula contains 80mg L-caritine, too.

Both this formula and the Original formula also contain 7% ash, a mineral that vets will tell you help contribute to male cats' urinary tract infections.

This is an OK food to feed shelter animals and strays, but I could never make this brand nor the formula my cats' regular diet.
summary: It's really not better than the Original formula

review_body: My cats love this food.
Did not work for my older cat.  Upset his digestive tract and the  wt said it was from "fillers" I'm the food.
summary: Did not work for my older cat. Upset his ...

Cats picked their way down to the larger dental diet kibble and spit the Iams on the floor. So much for trying a lower price cat food.

Does not help or lessen hairballs.
Waste of the extra money spent just for lhaieball control - which was the ONLY reason I bought it.
Disappointed.

review_body: Cats like it so I like it.

Best cat food on the market. My cats love it and they don't eat as much of it as the cheap stuff, so in the long run, it saves money. I does a good job of maintaining their weight and controlling hairballs.
summary: A great cat food and a good buy!
